eu_initiatives:
Europe 2020- Education and Training 2020 programme; Operational Programme for Cohesion Policy Funding 2014-2020, Bologna Process and European Higher Education Area; Erasmus + programme 
European Regional Development Fund; European Research Area
organisation_name: Eesti Maaülikool (Estonian University of Life Sciences) (EMÜ)
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
goals__remit:
Estonian University of Life Sciences is the only university in Estonia, whose research activities include in a holistic way the sustainable use of vital primary resources and the maintenance of life environment. The University creates and shares knowledge to the promotors of bio-economy for the best of Nature and Man.  
The Estonian University of Life Sciences contributes via value-chain-based approach to sustainable use of natural resources, environmental sustainability, coping with climate change, preserving biodiversity, providing food security, producing safe and healthy food, and promoting Estonian regional development. 
Strategic development goals 
•    Internationally recognized research 
•    Highly rated university education, graduates in high demand on the labour market. 
•    Advancing, motivated and united members of the University community 
•    The University encourages development in its areas of responsibility. Estonian University of Life Sciences supports the economic, cultural and social development 
•    The organization supports the main activities of the members of the University
